text: I discussed with David, and another employee,  the issues my dog was having with digestion issues and allergies. text:
CDT isn't our normal boarder, but i almost effed up Thanksgiving by forgetting to schedule Jackie to board. Creative Dog Training came through for us!

I couldn't believe they had room! And when we got there, they were SO NICE. Oh my gosh, i can't remember her name, but she was tiny & had dark hair like me. She was really able to make me feel confident about leaving him in their care.

Jack was having some hotspot issues, so she took his medicine & told me they keep a close eye on him. They also were able to put him in a play group for older dogs, which they posted pictures on Facebook every day! They also didn't care that I'm a helicopter dog mom & called every day to check. =)

I was so excited, i burst through the door at the facility & announced i was there to pick up my dog. (I also may have done a little dance.) The little girl from before said Jackie's name before i even got a chance to! They really know & care about their clients!

Also, when i picked him up, they'd been taking such great care of his hotspots, they were almost totally resolved!! =O

11/10 experience, will DEFINITELY board there again!

name: Lori Goldberg
text:
Do NOT take your dogs here!
This place is not sanitary. The workers leave dogs in pee and poop filled kennels for hours before they are cleaned.
The dogs don't go outside from 4pm to 7am the next day.
They have had 2 cases of kennel cough since spring break, and have still been using the same sponge to clean all of the dog bowls.
If your dog is having a health issue while boarding, the workers will not tell you about it if they don't think it's serious. There are dogs who get incredibly sick either from stress or other health problems that result in blood in the vomit and/or stool. The only thing they do is take the dogs food and water away and don't let them outside.
The dogs water bowls are only checked at 7am and then again at 4pm. So your dog may be going without water for any number of hours between those times and the workers will ignore it. The bowls are only cleaned once per day, so if your dog is boarding for several days, there's a very good chance that they'll have the same bowl of water over the course of their stay. They have a major rat problem there, so often times there is rat feces in the water bowls.
The dogs are left alone all night with the rats, which your dogs could be eating over night, making them very sick and possibly catching diseases.
The workers do not have first aid training, so if your dog chokes on the mulch that is outside in the play area, then they are told to "look up an instructional video" to help the choking dog.
They don't pay attention to what the dogs are doing because they're too busy on their phones to care. So if your dog poops mulch (very bad for his digestive system) then it's because they were eating it from the play area. There are also several dogs who eat poop, so if your dog has that habit, it's probably only getting worse because they think they're allowed to do it while staying there.
When the dogs are playing outside, they are sometimes not given water for several hours due to certain dogs not liking the water hose.
I have witnessed a coworker giving the wrong dog her medicine. Once that realization was made, still nothing was done about it.
If your dog is not good with other dogs, they are set as "individuals" where they play by themselves. These dogs are only getting 10 minutes outside to play, and then they get 10 minutes inside to play. They are supposed to have another 10 minutes to play but are usually skipped because the workers want to go home early. So if your dog is boarding over the weekend and they're not good with other dogs, then they're only getting about 20 minutes of outside time every day while the other dogs get over 2 hours.
The weekend hours are different, so all of the play groups are shortened and the dogs are left alone for a lot longer than they normally would be.
Their medicine is put in pill pockets in their food. If the dog doesn't voluntarily eat the pill pockets, then that dog will not be getting their medicine that day.
The dogs only have access to their food for a couple hours a day. So if your dog is a grazer and doesn't eat all of their food at once then they will be eating very little over the course of their stay.
The kennels are painted very poorly, paint is always chipping off the walls, usually because dogs are chewing it off.
Workers regularly spray dogs in the face with Bitter Apple spray. This spray is supposed to be used for dogs that have problems chewing their fur, and is not meant to be sprayed in the eyes or nose of the dogs, but they are regularly sprayed in the face if they are barking in their kennels.
If you request for your dog to be given a bath, they will usually bathe the dogs very early in the day to get it out of the way. Once they're bathed, they are not allowed back outside and their food and water bowls are taken away. So if you dropped your dog off at 8am to be picked up around 5pm, there's a good chance that your dog hasn't been outside or had food or water since about 10am.

resp.text:
Hi Lori, I wanted to reply here as well since I did not hear back from you regarding this same review you left on Facebook.
I'm truly sorry this is how you felt about working at CDT.

As one of the owners, and the person responsible for systems management in the locations I am very upset to hear these things. I'm also very concerned that not once had myself or any of the owners been contacted or told any of these things throughout the course of your employment there.

Because I can assure you, that not one thing you have said is company policy or are reflective of our systems we've built over 40 years.

There's nothing I can say to refute your claims because you cannot prove a negative, all I can say is that if you truly felt this way you should have come directly to myself, Margaret or Damian the multiple times we are all there per day whether helping out, working on things or just leaving our own dogs there for boarding or daycare.

At the end of the day, I'm sorry you feel this way about CDT. We have been doing this for over 40 years at this point, and have thousands of satisfied clients and dogs that I would hope reflect otherwise. If you would like to talk further or share specifics please send me a message because I would like to know details so I can address anything possible.

resp.text: Ms. Hill - Thank you for the feedback. Again, we are very sorry this happened during Chopper’s visit to Lucky Dog back in January. It is never a good day when a pup goes home with a boo boo. We strive to be as gentle and safe with the pets in our care as we can, but unfortunately, sometimes these things do happen and it breaks our hearts. You did fail to mention, though, that your Schnauzer is a puppy, was in for his first ever haircut and had barely been handled prior coming here. This, of course, does not excuse the incident, but it does give context to the situation. Schnauzers get a very short blade on their heads and Chopper was in the process of having his head shaved when he jerked in reaction to a sound in the salon causing his groomer to lightly graze the edge of the top of his ear. Our Salon Manager handled Chopper’s service and her incident rate was zero for the last year until this happened for which she was upfront and honest with you about and you told us you understood and even re-booked your next appointment. It was an incredibly minor nick as her reflexes are quick and it did not bleed. Again, we are very sorry that this happened to Chopper. We take things like this very seriously as it hurts us to see it happen, too. No groomer ever wants to accidentally injure a dog while in their care, but again, unfortunately, it is a trade risk when working with wiggly animals, especially puppies, and surgically sharpened equipment. Again, we deeply apologize and hope that you’ll reconsider letting us take care of Chopper in the future. Additionally, I urge you to compare our reviews to those of the salon you recommended. You’ll find they too have incidents happen and yours is our first complaint since we’ve been open. Thanks again for your feedback. ❤️

name: Avery Rhodes Akins
text: Lucky Dog is the BEST.  Not only do they go above and beyond with their grooming techniques but also truly care about and love our dogs!  Our dog Honey LOVES to go to Lucky Dog. We will never forget the compassion shown by the Lucky Dog staff to help us get him bathed despite his lack of mobility and huge size, not to mention their sympathy for us after his death.  Thanks Alyssa, Magan, and Teddy’s favorite caretaker, Roxanne, for being excellent, kind, professional, and full of integrity.

They also have an outstanding Dog Grooming salon. Where they work specifically to meet our sweet fur babies needs. You tell them what you want and that is exactly what they give you. They will also educate you in any better care your sweet baby might need at home after your amazing groom. And the prices, you cant find a better quality Groom for the price they offer. They are all around fantastic even offering you different packages to fit your every need! When I took my sweet fur baby Cooper to them.First thing they ask is what would you like to be done to Mr. Cooper. Not just snatching him up and taking him to the back to do whatever, they take there time with you and find out what you would like and then they meet every need! I would and have recommended them to EVERYONE so here is your chance! Choose Lucky Dog Grooming and Boutique for all of you fur babies needs!

name: Thomas Querbach
text:
1st and hopefully not the last visit. Boarded my dog for a week. Show up today, and nothing I asked was done. Besides boarding, I asked for a nail trim, groom and bath. Upon arrival, none of this was done. Prior to me boarding him, I was told twice on the phone to mention to one of the girls when I arrived.

When I dropped him off on the 8th, I had requested these services to be done. The girl that was there said it would be done and that they would call if they had any questions. When I get him today, I find out none of this was written down on his chart. I think you need to train your employees to write down notes on our pet’s chart when busy or not to ensure items requested are done correctly. I only give this two stars because your comped me on a nail trim and bath.

resp.text: Thomas, we apologize that our timing did not meet your expectations.  We do delay baths on boarding dogs so they are freshly bathed when you arrive for pickup.  For your wait time, we did not charge you for the bath and nail trim in hopes to make up for your short wait time.  We apologize this did not meet your expectations.  If you would like to discuss further, please feel free to call our office and ask to speak with either Janet or Tara.

text: Absolutely in love with this business and their staff. They constantly amaze me with how they treat my dog like their own. They know us and our dog by name, they constantly are sharing their accomplishments and experiences with us. My dog is absolutely in love with the staff, some days I worry my baby won’t even come home with me! Love this place!

name: Stew Hayles III
text:
Took my dog to the Barkery in October 2020. It was z horrible experience.  I blame myself because I waited until the last minute to make a boarding appointment at my usually facility, which is Golden Animal Hospital in Pike Road(great service and care everytime!). We boarded our 18 month old golden doodle for 10 days. He was supposed to be groomed the last day he was there. We keep his hair long so he was only supposed to be washed and trimmed.

When I dropped him off, the receptionist was nice enough but the place smelled very bad. I've used several dog care facilities since we're new to Montgomery and the Bakery was by far the worst in cleanliness.  The dogs and the administration area are all in one. This created a very unorganized check-in since the receptionist was moving, picking up and pushing dogs off the counter the entire check-in. I looked over this because we were literally flying out of town the same day.

10 days later, I called to the Barkery know I was headed to pick my dog up. They told me that they had to cut his hair down low because he had a few matted areas on his legs. I didn't like that but its understandable. I arrive to the counter and the owner hands me a bag of hair to "prove" how bad the matts were! They brought my dog out and he was literally shaved down to skin😥 It was so sad! They didn't even grind or clip his nails. It was clear that they had no clue what they were doing. They couldn't find his collar and leash. They said that I must have taken it with me. I usually take them with me at my normal grooming place but I thought I remembered leaving them. I didn't take the time to debate the point because I was almost numb at the sight of my dog. I just kept telling myself, "This is your fault for waiting too long to make an appointment and taking him to the ONLY place that had an opening" Now I know why they had an opening. For the life of me, I can not figure out how people are giving this place good reviews.

When I get home and the family and I console each other, lol.....I find my dogs collar and flea collar buried in his door food that I had left with the Barkery. My dog also wouldn't eat for days after we got him back and he was sick for at least a week. He sneezing and vomiting. Btw, he smelled horrible. I was trying to figure out what they used to wash him and if they actually bathed him the day before I picked him up.

This was the worst experience ever and I would learn to groom my own dog if this was the only place open. On top of all of this, the receptionist and owner never apologized for the haircut. They basically blamed me because I let him get matts.

Worst experience ever!

name: Jonathan Bowman
text: This place has helped my dog tremendously with his separation anxiety. The staff was amazing and took a lot of time making sure he was comfortable and okay being there without his family. He absolutely loves going now and tries to fight me to leave. I cannot say enough amazing things about this place!

name: Amber
text: Love the staff and they are so good to our pups! I get cute pictures of my babies and they always remember me when I come in!

name: Dan Knotts
text: The staff at the Barkery are awesome!  When I first brought my Jax in they ask a lot of questions at first and realized they just cared about him. He has anxieties and they made him feel good enough for me to leave without much fanfare. He must have played hard because he was out not long after getting home. I see why you ask questions like  allergies,  a jumper, aggressive etc. They cleaned him up and obviously took good care of him. Thank you Kim, I can see you are a true animal lover.

name: Monica Apps
text: My baby Pebbles loves her friends at daycare, every time I say let’s go to daycare she starts jumping around. I love the whole staff there, wonderful place of business.

name: Leigh Ann Bowden
text: Today I brought in my pit mix to get her nails clipped. She has never been a fan of having her paws touched, much less letting us clip her nails. Kim & her staff at The Barkery went above & beyond to make it an easy (instead of terrifying) experience for my Harleigh Girl. I even rewarded her with some of their delicious homemade dog treats. When Harleigh got some she was all smiles & absolutely loved her Banana Cupcake and Zebra Cookie. I would definitely recommend The Barkery to anyone looking for pet grooming, doggie daycare or even just a nail clip.

name: Sydni Bing
text: I bring my 3 fur babies to The Barkery for daycare and grooming. My dogs are always so excited when we pull in the parking lot they’re already trying to get to the doors!! The staff members are the sweetest things and i just couldn’t ask for a better second family for my babies.

I would rate a 10 out of 10 if I could

name: Maryla Webb
text: My dog is the best testament to the Barkery. He goes absolutely nuts when I take him there and yesterday didn't want to leave to come home.

name: Makayla Washington
text: Can’t say enough good things about how compassionate the staff here is!! My family recently had our four-legged family member, Nala, pass away. Nala used to have regular appointments with Kimberly and when they hadn’t heard from us around the time of her next one they reached out to check in. When we informed them of her passing you could tell the staff members were actually upset as well. Then a few days later in the mail they had even sent us a card apologizing for our loss. Whenever we decide to add another four legged member to our family, we will be returning. Thank you to The Barkery for treating all your clients like family!

name: Amanda Rowland
text: Recently started bringing my babies to doggy daycare at The Barkery. The girls at the front were very professional and took time making sure my babies were comfortable before starting to allow my babies in with the others. The environment is fun and happy. It was a joy seeing just how happy and excited the other dogs coming in were. We will most definitely be returning!!!!

name: Alexandria Harvest
text: Pet Parents BEWARE! On July 2, I dropped my dog Midnight off at The Barkery, we planned to go out of town, so we let the staff member know that we would want to do daycare and boarding, because we planned to go out of town and would be back late. We ended up not going out of town, so my sister called The Barkery  at 5:35 to inform them that we would not be boarding and we were coming to pick midnight up, she said okay, everything seemed normal. My sister got to The Barkery 6 minutes later and call and through tears told me that the Barkery allowed my dog to get out of their gate, around 5:00pm,  THIRTY MINUTES AGO. Apparently Haley the staff worker, did not want to upset her and tell her over the phone. Mind you, they thought we were boarding, and at no point did they reach out to either Emergency contact listed on the paperwork, had my sister not unexpectedly showed up, it looks like they had no plan to reach out. We were told that Haley was in one room(making mop water), and Kimberly the owner was in another room(cleaning) while the dogs were outside, and unattended. They heard a loud noise, and a customer who was coming to pick up their dog came in and informed them that a black dog with a blue collar had gotten out. They had no idea because they weren't watching. One Hour later, me and my siblings were out looking for my dog with NO ASSISTANCE from The Barkery.  No one called either of Midnight's listed emergency contacts,  reached out to establish a perimeter, or even apologize and explain what happened. I had to reach out to Kimberly and request that she call me via text. When she did call, she did not apologize, she simply blamed us because he jumped the fence, all while not looking for my dog that she lost. My dog has been coming to the barkery since they were on Woodley rd, and he's never jumped. Around 7 I went back to Barkery, and Kim

text: My yorkie,Oscar stayed all week for boarding while we went out of town for work and he loved it so much I didn’t think he was gonna leave and come back home to me!!! Stopped and got him a pup a chino afterwards:) We will definitely be back! Thankful to find someone I can trust with my fur baby! Thanks to,Kimberly and staff @TheBarkery

name: Zovi “Zovi” V
text: Pet Parents BEWARE! On July 2, I dropped my dog Midnight off at The Barkery, we planned to go out of town, so we let the staff member know that we would want to do daycare and boarding, because we planned to go out of town and would be back late. We ended up not going out of town, so my sister called The Barkery  at 5:35 to inform them that we would not be boarding and we were coming to pick midnight up, she said okay, everything seemed normal. My sister got to The Barkery 6 minutes later and call and through tears told me that the Barkery allowed my dog to get out of their gate, around 5:00pm,  THIRTY MINUTES AGO. Apparently Haley the staff worker, did not want to upset her and tell her over the phone. Mind you, they thought we were boarding, and at no point did they reach out to either Emergency contact listed on the paperwork, had my sister not unexpectedly showed up, it looks like they had no plan to reach out. We were told that Haley was in one room(making mop water), and Kimberly the owner was in another room(cleaning) while the dogs were outside, and unattended. They heard a loud noise, and a customer who was coming to pick up their dog came in and informed them that a black dog with a blue collar had gotten out. They had no idea because they weren't watching. One Hour later, me and my siblings were out looking for my dog with NO ASSISTANCE from The Barkery.  No one called either of Midnight's listed emergency contacts,  reached out to establish a perimeter, or even apologize and explain what happened. I had to reach out to Kimberly and request that she call me via text. When she did call, she did not apologize, she simply blamed us because he jumped the fence, all while not looking for my dog that she lost. My dog has been coming to the barkery since they were on Woodley rd, and he's never jumped. Around 7 I went back to Barkery, and Kimberly and her significant other, Jake arrived( how she had time to go get her boyfriend while she claimed she was looking for my dog, not sure). Kimberly ran inside the building, never spoke, never apologized and sent Jake, who is not an owner of The Barkery,  to "deal" with us. Apparently, Kimberly had lied to Jake and told him that she was threatened by myself on the phone and was called a b****h, which was untrue, I was actually quite pleasant all considered. When Kimberly finally came outside, I asked her was she ever threaten or called any obscenity and she said no that never happened. Jake went off to smoke his KOOL cigarette, because the whole reason he came was because of her lie.Why Kimberly would make herself to be the victim when she lost my dog is beyond me. Kimberly yelled us, blamed us,  cursed, and never once apologized. I understand that things happen, but if you're a dog sitter and you lose the dog, you need to take some form of responsibility and at least be sorry and try to help. Instead of being concerned,  Kimberly(owner) and her daughter, and another staff member keep screaming about their "Livelihood".  Thankfully, me and my family were able to go out looking at 6:00 am and posting lost posters and found Midnight near Huntingdon College. The staff members saw us looking for our dog, offered no help, and still no apology.  Today is July 9, and The Barkery has never followed up, or showed any concern for their negligence. My dog refuses to leave me or my sisters side since this event, so I'd advise you to find another place to drop off your four legged family member.

name: Tim Watts
text: I witnessed the entire staff act in a rude and extremely unprofessional manner . The entire staff allowed my sister's dog, Midnight, to walk away from the facility due to the staff not regularly monitoring the outside activities of the animals. Furthermore, they waited until a family member arrived at the facility to pick up the dog instead of calling the emergency contacts to notify of the situation, approximately 30 minutes after Midnight ran off. The owner, Kimbery, argued with us, accused us of calling her a derogatory term, admitted she lied about being called a derogatory term, and then refused to look for the dog. This incident occurred on Thursday, July 2nd. Today is July 5th and we have yet to hear from Kimberly on the status of the search for our dog. I highly recommend that you look elsewhere for your dog sitting needs.

name: Shantel Stewart
text: There is no doubt that there are plenty of boarding and grooming places to go to in Montgomery.  HOWEVER, The Barkery has a staff that is loving and caring.  I have been going here for about 6 years.  The staff is unbelievably loving and caring.  They become emotional attached to your dogs and become your friend.  Kim, Steve, and Sydni are all so very sweet.  If your dog is not the playful type, then they may not like this place.  The Barkery has a very dog friendly natural playful atmosphere where all of the dogs get to be dogs!  They get to play and socialize with one another and get treats and loved on by the staff.  Every dog owner is particular in their own way and that's understanding.  But despite them being our fur children, they are still dogs and want to play with one another and run around.  If you want your dog to have fun and be loved and for you to feel secure knowing that they are safe, then the Barkery is the place to go!!  I'll never go elsewhere.  My dog instantly gets excited the moment we pull up and is eager to run inside.  That lets me know that they too love going there.  And don't get me started on how amazing they smell when they get groomed.  As silly as it sounds, I could smell my dog all day after they get groomed.  I LOVE THE BARKERY!!!!

text: Kim is awesome. I love that I can leave my Sophie and not worry. She always has a good time.

text: The Barkery is and amazing place for fur babies they treat all the clients well and try to fit you in even when the packed. text: Did a wonderful job with our Keeshond dog with very affordable prices. Will most likely make it a monthly appointment.

name: Daniel Yu
text: Although the staff was very friendly, this was the first time my dog came to daycare and she got pretty beat up by the larger dogs during group play. This facility was referred to me from a friend and I'm strongly disappointed and angry that the staff allowed the dogs to play so rough. She had several puncture wounds all over her neck, shoulders and left arm. I assumed staff would look out extra for puppies when they group play with large breeds, but that's not the case. Will never return.

name: Jamie
text: Wonderful place to get everything for your pets. I love that they have such a large selection of Made in U.S.A. products, especially treats for dogs. Prices are comparable to other large chains and other small specialty stores but they do have sales on different items along with a program you can sign up for that keeps track and gives you a free bag of dog food after you buy 10. I went close to closing time so didn't get to look around as long as I would have liked but they didn't rush me and were extremely helpful. Even after telling them I was from out of town they still took the time to show me what was on sale and sign me up for the buy 10 get 1 free bag of dog food. I will definitely be back anytime I am passing through Montgomery on my way to Atlanta. I also saw on a sales booklet in my bag that they ship to Florida which is great also. If you spoil your dogs and or cats make sure to check this place out, you won't be disappointed.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-Stars, Jamie!

name: B Scott
text: Great store, selectionand staff.  Absolutely sad to hear they are closing.  There just aren't a lot of great pet stores in Montgomery.

resp.text: Thank you so much for this wonderful review. While we are closing this location, it brings us great sadness as well. The staff has worked hard to provide amazing service and products to this area and it brings us no pleasure to have to close a location. Thank you for your patronage and kind words.

text: Great solutions and the comfort of knowing whatever you get is good for your loved ones...  Staff is extra helpful as well!

resp.text: Thank you for the fantastic review, Denise!  Our team strives to go above and beyond to provide excellent service for our customers!  We're thrilled you're pleased and hope to see you again soon!

text: Knowledgeable staff. My pups love everything they have suggested.

resp.text: Brittany, thank you so much for your positive review! Our staff attends 40-50 hours worth of training on both products and customer service throughout the year to learn how to best serve our customers! We understand that dogs are a huge part of our customers’ lives, and we make it our mission to make them a part of the Feed Family! It is always a pleasure to have such wonderful feedback! We hope to see you again soon!

name: Susan
text:
Hollywood Feed came to Oliver's rescue and at very reasonable prices as well. My planned day trip turned into an overnighter because of bad weather and being overly tired. My service dog goes everywhere with me, but I didn't bring his food.

Their prices are very good for the quality products they carry. I was able to get a small bag of Fromm grain-free, chicken-free food a little cheaper than home. Oliver got to pick out a couple of new squeaky toys because the prices were so good. I got a few other other items that were comparable in price to discount pet stores.

The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. Oliver even found another girl friend, even though he didn't need any more. If I lived closer, I would go out of my way to shop here. I WILL stop by again when I drive through Montgomery. In addition to standard pet store products, they also have a good selection of boutique type items for human pet lovers.

resp.text: Susan, we can't thank you enough for taking the time to leave such a glowing review! Our team is dedicated to providing exceptional service to all of our customers - both human and four-legged! We work daily to ensure that our guests are offered the best products at the best prices so that pups like Oliver can be spoiled even more. We will be happy to see you two again!

resp.text: Thank you for the splendid review, Jenn!  Our team strives to go above and beyond to provide an excellent experience for all our customers!  We hope to see you again soon!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review, James! We always appreciate feedback from our customers as it helps us to learn and improve. We have a team dedicated to keeping our prices competitive with other retailers, while still maintaining the MAP prices that are required by the brands we carry. We even have a Price Match Guarantee! If you are able to find an identical product at another retailer listed at a cheaper price, we will investigate and match it for you! If you would like to provide further feedback, you are more than welcome to reach out to the regional manager of this location, Joy. You can reach out directly to her at joy@hollywoodfeed.com. We appreciate this opportunity to make things right and hope to make your next visit even better than your last!

text: Wanted to find a local groomer. Read reviews and asked neighbors and some referred me here. Was very hesitant of using a new groomer but was not visiting area where original groomer in near future. Gave groomer notes and sounded like all was understood. I understood my younger dog had knots in her hind legs and hair would possibly be cut short but never this. Gave my Scottish terrier a kennel cut!!!!!!!!   Enough said!! This shows lack of experience and very poor execution on team. If I had not paid before seeing my two girls, would have requested a full refund. Do not let the good reviews fool you. My other dog might’ve looked decent at glance but it is all square cuts no tapering like used to with my old groomer. I had trust in you Waggy tail. We will never come here again. Please remove us from your list of customers. As soon as my dog’s  hair grows back which now seems like will be an eternity, my girls will go back to our wonderful groomers in mountain brook where they are experienced beyond years and know what they are doing.

text: This place is hands down one of the best dog grooming and dog goodies store I have ever experienced! Jeni is amazing! The store is a MUST for anyone who loves to pamper their canine companions! I highly recommend all their services!! Thanks for such a wonderful experience!!

name: Niki Talley
text: I took my two beautiful King Charles Cavalier Spaniels for a bath and a cut. We even had a long talk with the groomer about how I wanted them to look and I was extremely disappointed. I asked for them to be lightly trimmed in specific areas and instead my dogs were practically sheared including their wings(on their legs) which one of the attribute that makes them beautiful. Do NOT go here. There was nothing professional or skillful in the way my dogs were butchered. I could've done better with the dog clippers I have at home.

name: Kenneth White
text: Loved the friendly service and they treated my Major very well. He loved the attention and will definitely be going there regularly

name: Stacey Powell
text: Such a cute and clean pet shop. They have the cutest leases and matching collar. They have a nice selection of pet bandana. However the selection of pet snacks from the bakery is worth the visit. This visit was for my Bulldog's 2nd Birthday. The have the cutest cookies, and Birthday cakes or cupcakes 🧁.  Little party hats in blue and pink. They also had Gotcha Day items.  They were busy grooming in the back and customers coming and going seemed pleased with their services. I noticed one lady had a special type of dog food special ordered for her pet. So this little shop offers alot. I found just what I needed , Thanks Wolfgang Bakery Milo & Chanel loved their treats.

name: Kelley Morehead
text: I could not believe the groom they did to my dog. I discussed with the groomer of how I wanted my dog to be trimmed. They cut all of her hair off. I mean they sheared all of my schnauzer’s traditional cut she’s had every since she had a puppie cut. I believe my dog is embarrassed to be seen without her beautiful hair. I WILL NEVER USE THEM AGAIN AND IF YOU HAVE A SPECIAL CUT YOU CAN JUST FORGET IT!

name: Lynn Miller
text: Love this place.  They really care about your dog and do the grooming right.  They even told me my maltipoo had an infection in her eyes and I was Leary but took her to vet and they were right.  They have the cutest boutique for dogs you have ever seen.

name: William Lee
text: Jennifer and her staff are always excited when our Golden Doodles come in to be groomed. The groomers do an amazing job and always praise our Doodles personalities. We haven’t purchased anything from the Bakery, but I have noticed there are always busy with customers.

name: Elizabeth Krause
text:
I already loved this place but my experience today really sold me. I will never love another pet supply shop like this one!!

I come in regularly with my dog to get her nails trimmed down. They have an excellent selection of fresh baked treats (with ingredients available if your dog has a sensitive tummy or allergies!), a bakery case that even has birthday cakes for dogs, and some very cute toys, collars, and bandanas. I always get my dog a little treat because I can’t help it! The fresh baked treat bar is also very affordable.

Today, I went in for our weekly nail trim. I got back out to my car and....nothing. It wouldn’t start. My dog was staring at me like “Come on, we did the nails, let’s go home for my mid-afternoon nap”. AAA took almost 3 hours to arrive, and Woof Gang let me and my dog hang out inside the entire time waiting for the tow truck because the car was so hot and I didn’t want my dog to overheat.

These people are pure angels (and for some reason, my dog even lets them cut her nails, which she is so picky about. Probably because they are the greatest people on Earth!!). I can not recommend them enough, and hopefully my car works again by next week for our weekly nail trim!!

name: Chelle Ham
text: Very clean and cute store. I went in for a rope style leash and they only had flat ones so I didn't make a purchase. They mostly had fancy dog treats so I'll be back around the holidays.
